overview:
Anna is a Managing Partner at TEC Ventures, a seed-stage venture capital fund, and a Managing Director of TEC (The Entrepreneurs’ Club, www.tecglobal.org) – an international network of 5,000+ high-tech entrepreneurs, executives, investors, and other professionals based in Silicon Valley.

For many years Anna was an angel investor with some of her portfolio companies rating as top 10 Russian high-tech startups. She also served as the President of the Russian-speaking network abroad, growing it from a small local gathering to the largest organization worldwide, and was the Founder of several premier high-tech conferences in Silicon Valley. She is the author of many articles on entrepreneurship, angel and venture financing.

In 2010, in partnership with Rusnano, Anna organized the first ever delegation of 20 Managing Partners representing top Silicon Valley VC firms with more than $60 bln under management to Moscow to meet with Russian business, investment and government elite, including President Medvedev. She also was the organizer and a host of the Russian President and his delegation’s visit in the Silicon Valley in June 2010.

Anna is a frequent speaker at international and executive conferences. She was featured on CNN, in Wall Street Journal, San Jose Mercury News, Silicon Valley/San Jose Business Journal, as well as major Russian TV channels and newspapers.

Anna holds her J.D. from the Moscow State Institute of International Relations (MGIMO) and her Master of Laws degree from Boalt Hall School of Law, University of California, Berkeley.
